page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS.
page.content: North Ferriby is located to the east of the Pennines,on the North bank of the River Humber.It is in between the Vale of York and the Vale of Holderness.It is approximately 15 kilometres to the west of Kingston upon Hull. To the north of the village is the A63. To the east is farmland and to the west is a Greenbelt called,'The Plantations'; further west lies Capper Pass, which is a smelting works, followed by more farmland and a partly disused airfield. North Ferriby is a 'dormitory village' and people commute to Hull using cars,rail and bus services. The village grew particularly in the eighteenth century with many large houses being built by the wealthy people of Hull.The village now has a range of house styles and prices.
